page.title: 13Kettlesing - A Night Out
page.content: Entertainment centres around either the village hall or the pubs/restau- rants. The Felliscliffe Village Hall, located near the Anglican Church, holds many social functions, from the occasional disco, to a Young Farmers' Club, the Women's Institute, and vo- cational courses, e.g., spinning. The two pubs, i.e., the Queen's Head in Kettlesing Village itself, and the Black Bull on the A59, are well pa- tronised, the former being a popular eating place. The licensed restaurant, The Millstones, is on the A59, attracting both passing traffic plus holding regular social functions, e.g., dinner dances and country-and- western evenings. Young people complain of lack of facilities for their age group, and tend to go to Harrogate for entertainment.
